title: Kenya: Court Suspends Order to Close Private Schools Over Teachers Strike
text:
The High Court has suspended the Education ministry's order for the closure of all private schools over the teachers' strike. 
Judge Mumbi Ngugi issued the directive on Monday saying the matter was urgent and persuant to justice. 
She noted that public schools will remain closed until further notice. 
The ruling was on a case by the Kenya Private Schools Association, which challenged the order to close all public and private schools, saying it had not been consulted. 
Association officials, who sued CS Jacob Kaimenyi and AG Githu Muigai, said reasons given for the closure did not concern private schools. 
The ministry had said the schools would be closed because of the little or no learning that followed the strike, which has entered its third week. 
It also said learners, staff and school property needed to be kept safe following concerns by parents and other key stakeholders. 
The association's officials added that private school teachers would have to be paid despite the closure of the schools and wanted the order suspended. 
Some private schools had said it would be difficult to comply with the directive issued last Friday without official communication. 
A spot check by the Star found most of them open and learning going on, despite the order for the schools to be closed from Monday. 
Public school students are likely to be on holiday for three months, following President Uhuru Kenyatta's declaration that the state cannot effect the pay hike. 
The case will be heard on Thursday. Kenya
